articles.name: Prevent - Understanding Prevent Settings
articles.title: Prevent - Understanding Prevent Settings
articles.body:
Tip: To access these settings, your organization must have deployed Prevent using the Deployment Center. If you do not see these options, please contact our support team for further assistance.

The Prevent Settings page is organized into two main tabs:

  • General
  • Policies

General Settings

The General Settings tab allows admins to manage the KnowBe4 Email Security Add-In and internal domains.

KnowBe4 Email Security Add-In

The KnowBe4 Email Security Add-In card allows you to download the add-in manifest, ready for deployment to your organization. This is where you can also manage how the add-in delivers security and configure real-time nudge timeouts to balance email scanning speed with user productivity.

Download Manifest

To download and install the KnowBe4 Email Security Add-In, select the Download Add-In Manifest button and follow the instructions provided in the Web Add-In - Deployment Guide for Prevent article.

Real-Time Nudge Timeout 

The Real-time nudge timeout setting helps you strike the crucial balance between providing real-time security nudges and ensuring email delivery remains fast and smooth.

This setting controls how long email sending pauses while the Email Security Add-In checks if a real-time nudge is needed.

  • If the check completes within the set timeout, the user will get a real-time nudge before the email is sent, if necessary.
  • If the check takes longer than the set timeout, the email will be held, and the gateway will scan it instead. Users will then receive an email nudge if the gateway detects a policy violation.

We recommend a timeout value of five seconds, which ensures most users receive real-time nudges without noticeably delaying email delivery.

Keep in mind that factors like attachments can impact the time it takes to complete a check. For instance, attachments add about two seconds to the email delivery time.

Tip:Longer timeouts ensure nudges are delivered in real-time, but may delay email sending for emails with attachments. Most emails get a real-time nudge in under three seconds. For best results, set your timeout to five seconds.

Internal Domain Management

Internal domain management helps Prevent accurately calculate email risk levels by distinguishing between internal and external recipients. This action is particularly important for detecting anomalies such as misdirected emails. Without a comprehensive list of internal domains, your organization's domains may be incorrectly classified as third parties.

To add internal domains, follow the steps below:

  1. Log in to your Prevent dashboard.
  2. Navigate to Prevent Settings > General > Internal Domain Management.
  3. Select + Add Internal Domains.
  4. In the pop-up window, enter the domain to add to your organization's internal domains list.
  5. Confirm that the domain belongs to your organization.
  6. Select Add Domain.

To remove an internal domain, follow the steps below:

Warning:Ensure you are not removing legitimate domains that your organization still uses.
  1. Log in to your Prevent dashboard.
  2. Navigate to Prevent Settings > General > Internal Domain Management.
  3. Locate the domain you wish to remove.
  4. Select Delete on the line containing the domain name.
  5. Select Confirm in the confirmation pop-up window.

Policy Settings

The Policies section displays all available Prevent policies. Each policy card contains tablet icons showing their current mode:

  1. Monitoring mode
  2. Nudging mode

To manage a policy’s settings, follow the steps below:

  1. Select the Manage Policy button on the policy you wish to update.
  2. Review the policy overview and the triggers that initiate user nudges.
  3. Choose the appropriate operation mode:
    1. Monitor & Nudge: Actively nudges users when policy violations occur
    2. Monitor: Tracks violations without alerting users
  4. Select Save.
  5. Select Save Changes in the pop-up window to confirm your changes.
Note:The Blocklist policy cannot be deactivated. If exceptions are required, create an exemption to the policy. Exercise extreme caution when creating exemptions to this policy. For further information on how to add an exemption, see the Prevent - Blocklist Exemptions article.

articles.name: Adding Users to Prevent User Groups
articles.title: Adding Users to Prevent User Groups
articles.body:
Prevent requires users to be added to specific Microsoft user groups to enable both the analysis of email behavior patterns and the delivery of security nudges. This article explains the importance of these groups and provides step-by-step instructions for adding users to them.

Provisioning Group

During the deployment process of Prevent, you will be asked to add your users to the Prevent Provisioning group. This critical step enables the system to:

  • Sync your users with the Prevent system
  • Begin analyzing their historical email behavior
  • Create a baseline understanding of communication patterns and relationships

We recommend adding all of your organization's users to this group to ensure Prevent has comprehensive data to work with. This step will maximize Prevent's effectiveness.

Nudge Group

Once you're ready to deploy Prevent's nudging functionality, users must be added to the Nudge group in Microsoft. Users in this group will:

  • Start receiving Prevent real-time nudges via the web add-in
  • Receive retrospective email nudges when applicable

If you want to roll out Prevent nudging to all of your organization's users, add them to this group. You can also choose to add users gradually if you prefer a phased deployment approach.

Propagation

Please be aware that due to Microsoft's system limitations, changes made to groups will not take effect immediately. Adding new users to groups typically takes between one and 24 hours to update. The KnowBe4 Email Security web add-in can take between 24 and 48 hours to propagate to users.

These delays mean newly added users won't immediately see Prevent nudges after being added to the relevant groups.

Adding Users to Microsoft Groups

To add users to the provisioning or nudge group in Microsoft, follow the steps below:

  1. Log in to the Microsoft 365 Admin Center.
  2. Navigate to Teams & groups > Active teams & groups.
  3. Locate and select the provisioning or nudge group.
  4. Select Membership and then Members.
  5. Select Add members.
  6. Search for and select the users you wish to add.
  7. Select Add to confirm your selections.

articles.name: Prevent vs Prevent Enterprise
articles.title: Prevent vs Prevent Enterprise
articles.body:
This article outlines the key differences between the default Prevent experience and Prevent Enterprise, focusing on functionality and detection capabilities. 

Key Differences 

The following list highlights the high-level differences between the default Prevent experience and Prevent Enterprise.

  1. Configuration Requirements
    • Prevent: Pre-configured detection policies are ready to use
    • Prevent Enterprise: Requires additional custom configuration by KnowBe4’s professional services team
  2. Detection Scope
    • Prevent: Focuses on common email security risks and errors
    • Prevent Enterprise: Extends protection to content-specific risks and organization-specific data protection needs 

Default Prevent Experience 

The default Prevent experience includes the following detection policies: 

  • Misdirected Email
    • Detects when a user sends an email to the wrong person
    • Finds errors that are typically caused by autocomplete
  • Misspelled Recipient
    • Identifies when a sender mistypes a recipient's email address
  • Salutation Mismatch
    • Flags when the recipient in the To or CC field does not match the recipient in the greeting of the email body
  • Large Recipient List
    • Alerts when there is a large number of recipients in the To or CC field
    • Nudges advise the sender to move external recipients to the BCC field to maintain recipient privacy
  • Data Exfiltration
    • Detects when a sender attempts to send an email to a personal or webmail account
  • New Recipient
    • Identifies when a sender emails an external recipient for the first time
  • Multi-Domain
    • Detects when two or more external domains are included in an email
  • Impersonation
    • Alerts when a sender is responding to an email that is impersonating a known recipient
  • Newly registered domain
    • Flags when a recipient domain was created in the last 50 days
    • Provides protection, as newly registered domains are often used for malicious activity
  • Blocklist
    • Warns when a recipient domain is listed on a blocklist

Prevent Enterprise

Prevent Enterprise includes advanced use cases that require further configuration tailored to each organization by KnowBe4’s professional services team. The Prevent Enterprise experience includes the following detection policies: 

  • Misdirected Content
    • An extension of the misdirected email detection
    • Detects occurrences of human error, specifically when sending an email with a data type in the email body that is not usually shared with the selected recipient
  • Data Loss Prevention
    • Custom configured to nudge users when organization or industry-specific words or data types are detected in an email body
    • Tailored to each organization's specific needs and compliance requirements

articles.name: Prevent Quickstart Guide
articles.title: Prevent Quickstart Guide
articles.body:
In this guide, you'll learn how to get started with Prevent, an AI-driven email security product designed to help you tackle outbound email risks. Prevent is a powerful cybersecurity tool that proactively identifies and mitigates outbound data risks by analyzing your outgoing communications. Prevent uses advanced AI to analyze emails in real time, focusing on sender behavior, content, and recipient to protect sensitive information from being inappropriately shared or exfiltrated. Prevent stops data breaches and incidents before they happen, supporting your organization’s users in real time.

To access the Prevent console, you must first use the deployment center to deploy Prevent for your organization. You can then use the Prevent console to customize data protection policies, alter Prevent configurations, and tailor the system to your organization and users. The Prevent dashboard provides you with an overview of the volume and nature of email events being analyzed and nudging your users, allowing you to conduct thorough investigations of potential data exposure incidents.

Tip:To view a Prevent product demo, see our KnowBe4 Product Demos article.

Deployment Center

The Prevent deployment center is a comprehensive wizard that allows admins to configure and deploy Prevent to their organization easily. Admins are guided through each section of the deployment process, and progress is saved at every step. Once the deployment center is complete, admins gain access to the Prevent console, where further customization and product configuration can be completed.

Prerequisites

To successfully complete the deployment center process, make sure you have the following prerequisites:

  • Microsoft 365 tenant
  • Global admin role on Microsoft 365 tenant

Deployment Center Steps

The following steps are completed in the deployment center:

  1. Domains: Confirm all of your organization’s internal domains that Prevent detects when syncing with Microsoft 365. This step is key to configuring Prevent optimally for your organization. For more information about the fields on the Domains page, see the list below.

    1. Primary Domain: Select the primary domain from your organization’s Microsoft 365 tenant.
    2. Internal Domains: Select all the internal domains that your organization owns and uses.

  2. Groups: Confirm the two Microsoft 365 groups that will be used for ingesting historical email data and to identify which users to nudge with Prevent advice. For more information about the fields on the Groups page, see the list below.

    Note:The groups used for ingestion and nudging can be the same. For initial testing purposes, it may be beneficial to have a different nudge group before the organization-wide rollout.

    1. User Provisioning Group: Specify the name of the group that will contain all users in your organization. All users in this group will be provisioned, and their historical and email data will be ingested to Prevent.
    2. User Nudge Group: Specify the name of the group of users who will receive nudges from Prevent when an email they send has a risk associated with it.
  3. KnowBe4 Email Security Add-In: A critical part of the Prevent service is the KnowBe4 Email Security Outlook add-in. Download the installation file and upload it to your Microsoft 365 environment. This ensures that all users in your designated nudge group can access the add-in and receive real-time Prevent advice. For more information about the fields on the Add-In page, see the list below.

    1. Download Add-In Manifest: Select the Download Add-In Manifest button to download the manifest for the add-in. The add-in provides Prevent functionality to your users.
  4. Email Nudges: In circumstances where real-time advice can be provided to users, Prevent will provide retrospective nudges. When an email is sent that triggers Prevent, the sender will receive an email from Prevent allowing them to continue or cancel the sending of their email. Specify the internal email address that Prevent should use to send retrospective nudges from, and the default action that should happen if a user doesn’t reply to the nudge. For more information about the fields on the Email Nudges page, see the list below.

    1. Email Nudge Address: Enter the email address that Prevent should use to send email nudges to users.
    2. Default Timeout: Select what happens when a user doesn’t reply to an email nudge. The original email can be sent or rejected after two hours if the user doesn’t reply to the email nudge.
  5. Summary: View an overview of all deployment steps and inputs captured so far for your confirmation and review.

  6. Gateway Deployment Steps: Grant the required permissions to create the gateway. For more information about the fields on the Deploying Gateway page, see the list below.

    1. Enable KnowBe4 Gateway: Select the Enable KnowBe4 Gateway button to grant the required Microsoft 365 permissions for the KnowBe4 gateway.
  7. Deploy: The deployment center will compile all the data you have provided and run the Prevent installation.

Summarized Changes

Once successfully deployed, the following changes will be made to your Microsoft tenant, allowing Prevent to function correctly.

During deployment, each organization will be configured with a unique domain. Configuring an accepted domain allows us to route emails to the Prevent gateway for processing. We do not configure an MX record, but we do use the MX record value.

App Registration Permissions Required Justification
Ingestion

Microsoft Graph > Application Permissions > User > User.Read.All

Microsoft Graph > Application Permissions > Group > Group.Read.All

Microsoft Graph > Application Permissions > Mail > Mail.Read

 Establishes an understanding of users’ email communication to allow Prevent to accurately nudge users when an issue is detected.
Connector Action
Microsoft 365 to Prevent Route mail to Prevent for Analysis
Prevent to Microsoft 365 Route mail back to Microsoft 365

The default name for the Prevent user provisioning group is "Prevent_Provisioning_Group." Prevent will ingest the profile information and 12 months of historical email data of users in this group.

The default name for the Prevent nudge group is “Prevent_Prompting_Group”. Prevent will nudge users in this group with advice when an email they send triggers a Prevent policy.

Dynamic expressions can be used to add users to these groups. For example, if you wanted to add all your users to the "Prevent_Provisioning_Group”, you could use a dynamic expression such as (user.mail -ne null) and (user.userType -eq "Member").

When a risk is detected, the Prevent Gateway will send a verification email to the sender to approve or reject whether or not the mail will be sent. This verification email is sent on behalf of the shared mailbox.

Transport Rule Action
Email Nudges Redirect relevant emails to the gateway for retrospective analysis.
Forward Replies to Email Nudges When a user responds to their retrospective email notification by choosing to either continue or cancel their email send, their reply is automatically directed to the email nudge mailbox for appropriate handling and review.

Prevent Console

Once deployment is complete and you have rolled out Prevent to your organization by adding the required users to the Prevent user group in Microsoft 365, you will have access to the Prevent console.

The console is comprised of the following pages:

  • Dashboard
    • The dashboard provides an overview and top-level statistics about your organization’s use of Prevent.
    • For further information, see the Prevent - Dashboard article.
  • Search Emails
    • The search emails page allows you to find and investigate email events.
    • For further information, see the Prevent - Search Emails article.
  • Settings
    • The settings page allows you to configure general settings and policy settings to suit your organization’s needs.
    • For further information, see the Prevent - Settings article.

Prevent Enterprise

Prevent is available in two distinct offerings to meet diverse organizational needs. The default Prevent experience provides essential outbound email security with AI-driven analysis and real-time protection against data breaches. For organizations requiring enhanced capabilities, Prevent Enterprise delivers additional advanced features and customization options. As an administrator, understanding which version your organization utilizes will help you leverage the appropriate tools and configurations to maximize your email security posture.

For further information, see the Prevent and Prevent Enterprise Overview article.

articles.name: Partner and Multi-Account: Upload Custom Training Content
articles.title: Partner and Multi-Account: Upload Custom Training Content
articles.body:
You can upload and manage custom training content from the Uploaded Content subtab of the Managed ModStore section of your console. Uploaded content is saved to your KnowBe4 account and can be accessed from any of your chosen managed accounts.

Once uploaded, custom content can be used the same way that any ModStore content is used. Uploaded content can be assigned to users via training campaigns, viewed by users in the Learner Experience (LX), and monitored by admins using training reports.

Content Requirements

See the sections below to review the compatibility requirements for uploading content to your KnowBe4 console.

Language Files

Language files refer to either Shareable Content Object Reference Model (SCORM) file packages or videos. You can upload one or more files, depending on how many languages the course is available in. If you only have the content available in one language, you only need to upload one language file.

Below are the requirements for each type of language file:

  • SCORM File Packages:
    • File Type: SCORM version 2004
    • SCORM Edition: 4th
    • Maximum File Size: 1 GB
    • Reporting Status: Complete/Incomplete or Passed/Failed
    • Content is included in the package and is not hosted on a third-party platform.
    • The package only includes one language.
  • Video Files:
    • File Type: MP4
    • Maximum File Size: 500 MB
    • Optimized for Web Streaming*

If you're unsure how to optimize your video or you would like us to do it for you, see our Troubleshooting Uploaded Training Content article for more information.

Artwork

You must add a square thumbnail image for your uploaded content. Make sure the image meets the requirements listed below.

  • File Type: JPEG or PNG
  • Maximum File Size: 10 MB
  • Maximum dimensions: 500px by 500px
    • The width and height of the image must be the same value.

Adding Content Details

Before you upload custom content, you'll need to add general details about your content, such as the title and the expected duration of the course.

Follow the steps below to begin creating your content:

  1. Navigate to ModStore > Uploaded Content.
  2. Click + Add Content in the top-right side of the page, then select whether you would like to upload SCORM Content or Video Content.
  3. On this page, fill out the details about the content. Add the specifications outlined below:

  4. Content Title: Add a descriptive title for your course. Your users will see this title when they log in to complete their training. This title cannot exceed 65 characters.
  5. Description: Provide a description of this content for future reference. The description will only be seen by admins and can't exceed 250 characters.
  6. Expected Duration (Minutes): Enter the estimated time it will take the user to complete the course. Enter a value between one and 360 minutes.
  7. Training Topic: Select a training topic for your course. This field will factor this course into our Risk Score calculations in future product updates. If Other is used, the course will be excluded from future Risk Score calculations.
  8. Not Recommended for KnowBe4 Learner App: Select this check box if you would prefer your users to access the training content through their LX. Users will still be able to access and complete the content in the KnowBe4 Learner App. For more information on this setting, see our FAQ: KnowBe4 Learner App for Admins article.
  9. Display in Library: Select this check box if you would like to display this content in the LX library. This content will be visible to your users.
    Important: If you have this option selected and want to archive the content, click View, click Edit Content Options, and unselect this check box.
  10. Artwork: Use the Choose File button to upload a square image that follows the requirements listed above. Users will see this thumbnail image in the KnowBe4 LX before they start the course.
  11. Click Save.

After providing the details above, you'll upload one or more language files to your content.

Uploading SCORM Language Files

After you create a new content set using the Adding Content Details section above, you'll upload at least one language file for your course. You can add as many language files to the course as necessary for your organization.

Note: You only need multiple language files if you need your course to support multiple languages. For example, if your organization has international offices or subsidiaries in different countries, you may need content available in multiple languages. By uploading all of the language files to one content set, you'll assign one course to all of your users and they'll choose their native language before beginning the assignment. See Learner Support: Change the Language of Training Content article for an example of the user experience.

Follow the steps below to upload one or more language files for your SCORM module:

  1. Navigate to ModStore > Uploaded Content.
  2. Click the Actions drop-down list, then select View. The content details page opens.
  3. Click + Add Language File, and add the details outlined below:

  4. Title: When you add a language file, the content title will populate by default. You can optionally change the language file title to the language of the content you're uploading. Users won't see language file titles when they log in to complete their training. The content title will be displayed for all languages of the course. See Learner Support: Change the Language of Training Content for an example of the user experience.
  5. Description: Provide a description of this content for future reference. This description will only be seen by admins.
  6. Language: Select the language of the SCORM package. Users can select this language from a drop-down menu before they begin the training. The first language file you add for the content establishes the default language of the course. If users don't select a different language, the course will play in the default language. You can change the default language of the content after adding additional language files. See the Edit Content and Language Files section for details.
  7. Attachment: Use the Choose File button to locate your language file or SCORM package. See the Content Requirements section above to ensure your file package is compatible.
  8. Upload File: Upload the language file to the content set. Your file will be scanned for viruses before it's uploaded to the console.
Important: The time it takes to upload your SCORM package depends on your internet connection speed and the size of your file. Don't navigate away from the page before the upload is complete.

Once you've uploaded a language file, specifically a SCORM package, see the Verifying Language Files section below for instructions on the verification process.

Uploading Video Language Files

After you've created a new content set, as seen in the Adding Content Details section above, you'll upload at least one language file for your course. You can add as many language files to the course as necessary for your organization.

Follow the steps below to upload one or more language files for your video module:

  1. Navigate to ModStore > Uploaded Content.
  2. Click the Actions drop-down list, then select View. The content details page opens.
  3. Click + Add Language File, and add the details outlined below:

  4. Title: When you add a language file, the content title will populate by default. Changing the language file title is optional. Users won't see language file titles when they log in to complete their training. The content title will be displayed for all languages of the course.
  5. Description: Provide a description of this language file for future reference. The description will only be seen by admins.
  6. Language: Select the language of the video file's content. Users can select this language from a drop-down menu before they begin the training.The first language file you add for the content establishes the default language of the course. If users don't select a different language, the course will play in the default language. You can change the default language of the content after adding additional language files. See the Edit Content and Language Files section for details.
  7. Video File: Use the Choose File button to locate your video file. The video must be in MP4 format and smaller than 500 MB.
  8. WebVTT file (optional): WebVTT files can be used to display subtitles or captions on your content.
  9. Upload File: Upload the language file to the content set. After upload, your video will be scanned for viruses and converted to a SCORM file package for LX compatibility.
Important:The time it takes to upload your video file depends on your internet connection speed and the size of your file. Don't navigate away from the page before the upload is complete.

Verifying Language Files

After you've uploaded your language file, an automated verification is performed. Once the automated verification is complete, follow the instructions below to manually review the file to determine whether your course will successfully play in the KnowBe4 learner experience.

If you're having trouble completing the review steps or if your course isn't behaving as expected, see our Troubleshooting Uploaded Training Content article.

  1. Launch File: Click this button to launch your file in a new window. Take note of the time that you launched the course. Once you launch your file, the verifications should begin to auto-populate.
  2. Launch the file. Does the file start successfully?: If the course successfully launches, the current date will populate to the right of this question. Click the checkbox to verify this step.
  3. Continue reviewing the file. Is the time you've spent viewing the file indicated accurately?: Navigate through your course and note whether the amount of time you've spent in the course is accurately reflected to the right of this question. If so, click the checkbox to verify this step.
  4. Finish reviewing the file and close the window. Does your status show as Complete?: Navigate through and complete your entire course. If you've uploaded a video module, play the entire video. If the course shows Complete to the right of this question, use the check box to verify this step.
    • This verification step will show Complete or Incomplete regardless of whether the SCORM package has a Complete/Incomplete or Passed/Failed reporting status.
  5. Optimize Video Use this link if your uploaded video isn't displaying correctly. See our Troubleshooting Uploaded Training Content article for more information on optimizing your video.
  6. Need Help? Use this link to navigate to our Troubleshooting Uploaded Training Content article.
  7. Approve File: Once you've confirmed the steps above, use this button to complete the review.

Publishing Language Files

After verifying that your language file is compatible, you must publish it before it can be used. Once published, the course will be available to assign in training campaigns.

  1. Use the link to read the Terms and Conditions for uploaded content, then click the checkbox to agree.
  2. Click Publish on the right-hand side to make sure your language file available in training campaigns.
Tip: As a best practice, before assigning uploaded content to your users, we recommend enrolling yourself or a small group of admins into a test training campaign with your custom content as the assignment. This way, you can ensure the time spent in the course and the completion status are accurately recorded in your console.
Note:If you’re publishing language files for content assigned in an active campaign, the newly published language will be immediately available to all users in the campaign. If you're replacing an existing language file with a newly uploaded file, all users who haven’t completed the course will have their progress reset regardless of which language file is affected.

Editing Content and Language Files

You can manage and update your uploaded courses from the Uploaded Content tab in the ModStore section of your console.

Click View to the right of any uploaded content to view and edit that content.

Toward the top of the View Content page, you'll see general information about the content. On the bottom portion of the page, you'll find the language files you've uploaded.

Important: Any changes you make to the title and description may take up to one hour to appear for all users.

Edit Content Options

Use the Edit Content Options button to edit the information outlined below:

  1. Image: The artwork you've uploaded for this content.
  2. Title: The title you've created for this content.
  3. Description: The description you've added for this content.
  4. Expected Duration: The amount of time you've estimated this course will take to complete.
  5. Last Updated: The date and time that the Content Options or language files were last updated.
  6. Default Language: The language selected during the first language file upload establishes the default language for the content. You can change the default language by editing the Content Options once you've added two or more language files to the content set.

Edit Language Files

From the content details page, select Preview from the Actions menu to preview language files. If you'd like to change a language file's title, language, or description, or update it with a new SCORM file package, select Edit from the Actions.

Important: If your content is assigned in an active campaign and a language file is updated with a new file, all users who have not completed their course will have their progress reset, regardless of which language the user is taking the content in.

Archiving or Restoring Content

You can archive content that you no longer want to use by following these steps:

  1. Navigate to the ModStore > Uploaded Content.
  2. Click the Actions drop-down menu next to the content you would like to archive.
  3. Click Archive.

If you would like to restore archived content, follow the steps below:

  1. Navigate to ModStore > Uploaded Content.
  2. Click the Archived link to view all content you've archived in the past.
  3. Click the Actions drop-down next to the content you would like to restore.
  4. Click Restore.

Adding Uploaded Content to a Managed Account

On the Uploaded Content subtab, click the Actions drop-down for the uploaded content, then select Add to Managed Accounts.

Select one or more accounts from the drop-down menu on the Add Content to Managed Accounts pop-up window, then click Ok. The content is added to the Uploaded Content page of the selected accounts.

Assigning Uploaded Content in Managed Training Campaigns

Once you've published one or more language files for your uploaded content, you can assign your course to managed training campaigns. For more information about creating and monitoring managed training campaigns, see our Create and Monitor Managed Training Campaigns article.

When creating your campaign, you'll find uploaded content in the Courses section of the Content drop-down menu, shown below. See the Editing Language Files section above for important information about updating language files when uploaded content is assigned in an active campaign.

You will also need to select which managed accounts you want to enroll in the campaign.

Clicking in the Enroll field opens the Managed Accounts window. See the options outlined below.

  1. Total Accounts: Select the account(s) you would like to include in the campaign.
  2. Add/Remove: Add the account to the Selected Accounts list. If you want to remove an account from this list, select an account, then click the Remove button.
  3. Selected Accounts: Lists the accounts selected to be in the campaign.
  4. Click Submit.
Tip: As a best practice, before assigning uploaded content to your users, we recommend enrolling yourself or a small group of admins into a test training campaign with your custom content as the assignment. This way, you can ensure the time spent in the course and the completion status are accurately recorded in your console.

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

Why isn't my uploaded content available for selection when creating a training campaign?

Before you can assign uploaded content to your users, you must verify and publish one or more language files for the content set.

How can I preview my uploaded content before assigning it in a training campaign?

After your uploaded content has been verified and published, you can preview your course from the View Content page. Click the Preview link toward the right side of any language file that has been added to the content set.

Why am I getting an error message when trying to upload my SCORM or video file?

If you're having trouble uploading your files, see our Troubleshooting Uploaded Training Content article.

How are antivirus detections performed on SCORM files?

The platform uses ClamAV to scan all uploaded language files.

How many courses can I upload to my KnowBe4 account?

You can add up to 100 custom courses to your account. Each course, or content set, can contain as many language files as needed for your organization.

After users complete custom training content, can I view their quiz scores?

Yes. To save scores for eligible content, enable the Track Scores option when creating your training campaign. See our Training Campaigns Guide for more information.

Can I delete a custom module that I uploaded?

Custom modules that you have uploaded cannot be deleted due to their impact on reporting integrity. However, you can update existing content rather than create new uploads and archive old items. This approach allows you to maintain consistency in your reports while still modifying your custom modules as needed. We recommend editing your existing content uploads to ensure seamless reporting and efficient content management.

What types of information can a SCORM file share with the KnowBe4 learning management system (LMS)?

The following data can be sent from a SCORM file to our LMS:

  • Completion Status: Displays whether or not the learner has completed the course or a specific learning objective in the course.
  • Success Status: Displays whether or not the learner has mastered the material according to defined criteria, such as passing a quiz or achieving a certain score.
  • Score: Consists of quantitative performance data, including raw scores, minimum or maximum possible scores, and scaled scores.
  • Time: Displays the amount of time the learner has spent in the course or a specific learning activity.
  • Interactions: Displays detailed information about the learner's interactions with the course content, which can include:
    • Interaction ID: The unique identifier for each interaction the learner has with content.
    • Interaction Type: The type of interaction such as true or false, multiple choice, fill-in-the-blank, matching, and Likert scales.
    • Objectives: The objectives associated with the interaction.
    • Timestamp: The exact time the interaction occurred.
    • Correct Responses: The correct answers for the interaction.
    • Learner Responses: The actual responses from the learner.
    • Result: Whether the learner's response was correct, incorrect, or neutral.
  • Path Navigation: Displays the choices the learner makes in terms of navigation through the course content, which might not be linear.
  • Bookmarks: Saves the learner’s location in the course so they can resume it later.

Where is my uploaded content stored?

It depends on which KnowBe4 instance you use.

See the table below to find where your uploaded content is stored in Amazon Web Services’ Amazon Simple Storage Service (AWS S3).

articles.name: Cornerstone Integration Guide
articles.title: Cornerstone Integration Guide
articles.body:
The KnowBe4 integration with Cornerstone OnDemand (CSOD) Learning allows you to sync the KnowBe4 content catalog directly into your Cornerstone Learning platform. This article explains how the integration works, what kind of content is available, and what requirements are needed for using this feature.

Note: This integration does not sync training or phishing campaigns from KSAT to Cornerstone Learning. These campaigns remain separate and must be managed in KSAT.

How the Integration Works

Once synced, KnowBe4 appears as a provider on your Cornerstone platform. Your learning admins can assign KnowBe4 content to learners, who will interact with it directly through Cornerstone.

When learners launch content:

  • They are authenticated and directed to the appropriate content
  • They see a language selection page showing available training languages
  • Their progress is tracked as they complete the course
  • Progress data is sent back to Cornerstone

Requirements

The following requirements must be met to use this integration:

  • You must have a Diamond-level or Training Only Diamond-level subscription
  • This integration must be purchased through the Cornerstone OnDemand "Edge Marketplace."
  • SAML authentication is required for proper user authentication
  • This integration works with third-party identity providers (IdPs)
  • If you don't have SAML set up, you can use Cornerstone as the IdP for KSAT

Setting Up the Integration

After purchasing the integration:

  • You can enable this feature in Account Settings. Go to Account Integrations > Cornerstone Integration, and then click the Enable Cornerstone Integration toggle.

  • When enabled, the KSAT console will display your Cornerstone ID (CIID) under the Account Integrations > Cornerstone Integration section of the Account Settings page.

  • Provide this CIID to Cornerstone to set up the connector in your CSOD Learning Environment.

Available Content

The following content is included in the integration:

  • Standard KnowBe4 training content
  • Compliance Plus content, if you have an active subscription
Note: All languages associated with the content are supported.

The following content types are not included in the catalog sync:

  • Newsletters and Documents
  • Posters and Artwork
  • Student Edition Content

Additional Resources

For more detailed information about setting up this integration, reach out to your Customer Success Manager or contact our support team.

If you are interested in using our Cornerstone integration, go to the Edge Marketplace in Cornerstone OnDemand (CSOD).

articles.name: Program Maturity Assessment (PMA) Overview
articles.title: Program Maturity Assessment (PMA) Overview
articles.body:
KnowBe4’s Program Maturity Assessment (PMA) is a free tool that gives you quick insight into what level your organization ranks regarding its security culture and risk awareness. Your results will show you how to improve your organization’s level. The PMA questionnaire is approximately five minutes long. 

Getting Started

To get started with your PMA, follow these steps below.

  1. Go to the Program Maturity Assessment (PMA) page on KnowBe4’s website.
  2. Enter your information, including your name, business email address, company name, and phone number, under the Get Your Maturity Assessment Now section at the right of the page.
  3. Click the Sign Up button.

  4. Within a few minutes, you should receive an email with the subject line Program Maturity Assessment. Check your Spam folder if you don’t see the email in your primary inbox.
  5. In the email, click the Start Assessment button. The assessment should open in another browser tab.

  6. To begin the assessment, click the Start Questionnaire button.

Taking the Assessment 

The PMA will evaluate your organization across 40 maturity indicators in ten critical dimensions of human risk management: 

  • Leadership and Strategy: Is cybersecurity a priority to leadership?
  • Awareness and Behaviors: Is your training inclusive and relevant?
  • Employee-focused Security Tools: Have you implemented multi-factor authentication (MFA), password managers, and phishing reporting tools?
  • Policies and Procedures: Are your security policies clear and accessible?
  • Employee Mindset: Do your people take personal responsibility for security?
  • Measurement and Metrics: How do you track program effectiveness?
  • Continuous Improvement: Does your program evolve based on new threats?
  • Employee Engagement: Do people actively participate in security initiatives?
  • Risk Awareness: Do employees understand your organization's specific risks and the security impact of their actions?
  • Integration with Business: Is security incorporated into everyday processes?

In each of these ten sections, select your level of agreement with several statements, from Strongly Disagree to Strongly Agree. For example, view the Leadership and Strategy section below, the first of the PMA’s ten sections:

When you complete the ten sections, your PMA score will be calculated, and an action plan will be customized for your organization. 

Understanding Your Assessment

The Assessment Results page provides insight into what level your organization ranks regarding its security culture and risk awareness.

The maximum score an organization can receive is 200, and there are five levels that could match your organization. The five levels are as follows, from lowest to highest:

  1. Basic Compliance: The minimum security requirements to meet regulatory standards
  2. Security Awareness Foundation: Building awareness across the organization
  3. Programmatic Security Awareness and Behavior: A structured program with measurable outcomes
  4. Security Behavior Management: Active management of security behaviors
  5. Sustainable Security Culture: Security embedded in organizational DNA

At the lowest level (Basic Compliance), your organization’s risk of a security breach is the highest. However, as you increase your organization’s human risk management practices, the likelihood of a security breach decreases.

Your results will also include a spider diagram showing performance by section and horizontal bar graphs showing your scores in each of the ten sections.

Under the Ready to Advance Your Maturity Level? section, you can download your full PMA report with an action plan customized for your organization by clicking the Download Full Report button. Your report will be downloaded as a PDF file. If you have any questions regarding your report, click the Contact Us button.

If you would like to retake the Program Maturity Assessment, click the Retake Assessment button at the bottom of the Assessment Results page.

Program Maturity Assessment Results Email

Your results, including your full report with an action plan customized for your organization, will also be sent to the email address you previously provided. You can review the Assessment Results page again by clicking the Review Results Summary button, contact us if you have any questions, and retake the assessment via the link at the bottom of the email.

articles.name: Key Metrics Information Placeholders Guide
articles.title: Key Metrics Information Placeholders Guide
articles.body:
You can use the key metrics information placeholders to populate key performance indicators, such as your organization's Risk Score trend or Phishing Security Test (PST) data, into your executive reports. For general information about placeholders, see our Placeholders Guide.

For information about each of the key metrics information placeholders, see the table below:

Placeholder Name Placeholder Drop-Down Menu Option Information Populated
[[training_completion_percentage]] Training Completion % This placeholder populates the percentage of mandatory training completed over a specific time frame.
[[training_completion_trend]] Training Completion Trend This placeholder populates the completion trend for mandatory training completed over a specific time frame.
[[optional_learning_completion_percentage]] Optional Learning Completion Percentage This placeholder populates the percentage of optional learning completed over a specific time frame.
[[optional_learning_completion_trend]] Optional Learning Completion Trend This placeholder populates the completion trend for optional learning completed over a specific time frame.
[[ai_recommended_training_completion_percentage]] AI-recommended Completion Percentage This placeholder populates the percentage of AI-recommended training completed over a specific time frame.
[[ai_recommended_training_completion_trend]] AI-recommended Training Completion Trend This placeholder populates the completion trend for AI-recommended training completed over a specific time frame.
[[all_training_completion_percentage]] All Training Completion Percentage This placeholder populates the percentage of all training completed over a specific time frame.
[[all_training_completion_trend]] All Training Completion Trend This placeholder populates the completion trend for all training completed over a specific time frame.
[[training_hours]] Total Mandatory Hours Trained This placeholder populates the total number of hours spent on completed mandatory training over a specific time frame.
[[training_hours_trend]] Total Mandatory Hours Trained Trend This placeholder populates the completion trend for the total number of mandatory training hours completed over a specific time frame.
[[optional_learning_hours]] Total Optional Learning Hours This placeholder populates the total number of optional learning hours completed over a specific time frame.
[[optional_learning_hours_trend]] Total Optional Learning Hours Trend This placeholder populates the completion trend for the total number of optional learning hours completed over a specific time frame.
[[ai_recommended_training_hours]] Total AI-Recommended Training Hours This placeholder populates the total number of hours spent on completed AI-recommended learning over a specific time frame.
[[ai_recommended_training_hours_trend]] Total AI-Recommended Training Hours Trend This placeholder populates the completion trend for the total number of AI-recommended training hours completed over a specific time frame.
[[training_optional_enrollments_completed]] Total Optional Learning Enrollments Completed This placeholder populates the total number of optional learning enrollments completed over a specific time frame.
[[training_optional_enrollments_completed_trend]] Total Optional Learning Enrollments Completed Trend This placeholder populates the completion trend for the total number of optional learning enrollments completed over a specific time frame.
[[training_enrollments_completed]] Total Completed Training Enrollments This placeholder populates the total number of training enrollments completed over a specific time frame.
[[training_enrollments_completed_trend]] Total Completed Training Enrollments Trend This placeholder populates the completion trend for the total number of training enrollments completed over a specific time frame.
[[training_optional_enrollments_completed]] Total Completed Optional Learning Enrollments This placeholder populates the total number of optional learning enrollments completed over a specific time frame.
[training_optional_enrollments_completed_trend]] Total Completed Optional Learning Enrollments Trend This placeholder populates the positive or negative trend for the total number of optional learning enrollments completed over a specific time frame.
[[phishing_tests_delivered]] Total PSTs Delivered This placeholder populates the total number of PSTs delivered over a specific time frame.
[[phishing_tests_delivered_trend]] Total PSTs Delivered Trend This placeholder populates the positive or negative trend for the total number of PSTs delivered over a specific time frame.
[[phishing_failures]] Total PST Failures This placeholder populates the total number of PST failures over a specific time frame.
[[phishing_failures_trend]] Total PST Failures Trend This placeholder populates the positive or negative trend for the total number of PST failures over a specific time frame.
[[phishing_reported]] Total Simulated Emails Reported This placeholder populates the total number of simulated emails reported over a specific time frame.
[[phishing_reported_trend]] Total Simulated Emails Reported Trend This placeholder populates the trend of total simulated emails reported over a specific time frame.
[[phishing_failure_percent]] Total PST Failure % This placeholder populates the percentage of PST failures over a specific time frame.
[[phishing_failure_percent_trend]] Total PST Failure % Trend This placeholder populates the positive or negative trend for the percentage of PST failures over a specific time frame.
[[pab_reported]] Total Non-Simulated Emails Reported This placeholder populates the total number of non-simulated emails reported over a specific time frame.
[[pab_reported_trend]] Total Non-Simulated Emails Reported Trend This placeholder populates the trend of total non-simulated emails reported over a specific time frame.
[[risk_score]] Organization Risk Score This placeholder populates your organization’s Risk Score.
[[risk_score_trend]] Organization Risk Score Trend This placeholder populates the positive or negative trend for your organization’s Risk Score.

articles.name: GCC High Phish Alert Button (PAB) Product Manual
articles.title: GCC High Phish Alert Button (PAB) Product Manual
articles.body:
The Government Community Cloud (GCC) High Phish Alert Button (PAB) for Microsoft 365 enables your users to easily report suspicious emails, strengthening your organization's defense against sophisticated phishing attacks. Built for the highly regulated GCC High environment, this PAB operates seamlessly within these security-enhanced infrastructures.

Note:The GCC High PAB does not support mobile devices.

Prerequisites

Before you install the GCC High PAB, your organization will need to have one of the following mail servers:

  • Microsoft 365
  • Microsoft Outlook 2019 or 2021 for Mac with either Exchange 2019 or Microsoft 365.

If you have a proxy server, you’ll need to connect to all of the following to bypass the proxy server or proxy authentication:

  • outlook.office365.us
  • outlook.office.us
  • us.pab.knowbe4.com, eu.pab.knowbe4.com, or ca.pab.knowbe4.com, depending on your KnowBe4 instance.

You’ll also need to enable and configure the PAB from your KnowBe4 console Account Settings page before following the steps in this article.

Important: Contact our support team to enable GCC High PAB for your account. Then follow the steps below to install it.

Enable Permissions in Your KSAT Console

Before installing the GCC High PAB for Microsoft 365, follow the steps below:

  1. Log in to your KSAT console.
  2. Click on your email address in the top-right corner of the page, then select Account Settings.
  3. Navigate to Account Integrations > Phish Alert.
  4. Select the Enable Phish Alert toggle.
  5. Select your PAB instance.
  6. From the Select PAB Version drop-down menu, select GCC High Hybrid PAB

  7. Scroll down and click Authorize NAA-SSO for GRAPH APIs. You’ll be redirected to the Microsoft 365 login page.

  8. Log in to your Microsoft 365 account using your admin credentials.
  9. Once you log in, the Permissions requested pop-up window will display. Read the permissions, then click Accept

  10. After you accept the permissions, the GRAPH Authorization Successful window will display. Click Back to PAB Configuration to return to the Phish Alert settings.

  11. Click the download icon next to the PAB manifest for Microsoft products option to download the PhishAlertManifestGCCHigh.xml file.

    Note:Each Phish Alert Button (PAB) XML manifest file is unique to the KSAT console based on where it's downloaded. So, if you manage multiple KSAT consoles, you'll need to download and install the correct manifest file for each console separately.

Install the GCC High PAB in Microsoft 365

Note: GCC High environments have a different M365 Admin console and do not have access to the Office store. For additional information, see Microsoft's documentation.

Follow the steps below to install the GCC High PAB in your Microsoft 365 account.

  1. In a new browser tab, log in to your Microsoft 365 admin center.
  2. From the navigation menu on the left side of the page, navigate to Settings > Add-ins.
  3. On the Add-ins page, click Deploy Add-in.
  4. In the Deploy a new add-in pop-up window, click Next.
  5. Click Upload custom apps.

  6. Select I have the manifest file(.xml) on this device. Then, click Choose File and upload the PhishAlertManifestGCCHigh.xml file.
  7. Click Upload to install the GCC High PAB.

  8. From the Configure add-in pop-up window, select which users will have access to the GCC High PAB and which method you want to use to deploy the PAB.

    Important:We recommend allowing all users to access the PAB and using the Fixed deployment method.

  9. Click Next. Additional app permissions will display.
  10. Once you’ve read the permissions, click Save.

  11. The Deploy Phish Alert pop-up window will confirm that the add-in has successfully deployed. Then, click Next.

  12. The Announce add-in pop-up window will open and display a message about Microsoft’s announcement recommendations.
    Note:After you install and deploy the PAB, you might receive an email from your mail service provider that contains information you can use to help you announce the PAB add-in to your users. KnowBe4 does not send the email about the PAB's intended usage and benefits.

  13. Click Close.

articles.name: Understanding Emails from PhishER
articles.title: Understanding Emails from PhishER
articles.body:
Did you receive an email like the one displayed below and wonder what it is? Fear not! This email is actually from an admin in your organization.

What You Need to Know

A simulated email is from a KnowBe4 Phishing Security Test sent from your organization, while any other email is considered non-simulated. When you report a non-simulated email with the Phish Alert Button (PAB), a copy is forwarded to your admins for review in their PhishER console.

Once your admin reviews the reported email, they may send you a message like the one displayed above. Any responses you send to these emails are sent back to your PhishER admins for review and are treated like direct messages so that they can respond in real time!

If you have any questions or concerns, contact your internal IT team or our support team.

articles.name: SecurityTips Guide
articles.title: SecurityTips Guide
articles.body:
The SecurityTips subtab is where you manage SecurityTip content and notification templates used in real-time coaching campaigns. SecurityTips can be used to coach your users about their risky activity and how to avoid it in the future.

You can leverage preexisting SecurityTip content or upload custom graphics. SecurityTips are automatically localized to match the recipient's training language. For instructions on uploading custom graphics, see our Upload Custom SecurityTip Graphics article.

Each SecurityTip content item is represented by a card on the Media Catalog page. SecurityTips are available in image, GIF, or video formats. A GIF icon indicates the GIF format, a graphic icon indicates the graphic format, and a video icon indicates the video format. Clicking a card allows you to preview the SecurityTip content.

Note:When available, localized versions of SecurityTip content are displayed in the user’s training language.

Media Catalog

The Media Catalog page includes several interactive elements for filtering and managing SecurityTip content:

  1. Media Type: Click this drop-down menu to filter media by type.
  2. Source: Click this drop-down menu to choose between System media and Custom uploaded media.
    Note:Only custom images are currently supported for SecurityTips.
  3. Topics: Click this drop-down menu to filter media by category.
  4. Languages: Click this drop-down menu to filter media by language.
  5. Search: Enter a keyword used in the media title to filter your results.
  6. Media Type label: This label indicates whether the media is available in image, GIF, or video format.
  7. Title label: This label displays the title of the SecurityTip media.
  8. Language label: This label displays the number of available languages for the SecurityTip media.
  9. Topics label: This label displays the category for the SecurityTip media. We offer SecurityTip media for several categories, such as Malware, Social Media, and Ransomware.
  10. Create Campaign: Click this button to create a campaign using this SecurityTip media.
  11. + New SecurityTip: Click this button to create a custom SecurityTip.

Notification Templates

The Notification Templates page allows you to manage and view notification templates. For information on customizing templates, see our Customize SecurityTip Notification Templates article.

articles.name: Smart Groups for Reporting Use Cases
articles.title: Smart Groups for Reporting Use Cases
articles.body:
Smart Groups allow admins to categorize individuals based on profile attributes, actions, and risk levels. Once created, these groups can be used to schedule testing, training, and communication.

Key benefits of Smart Groups in reporting include:

  • Comparison: Enabling the sorting of users by profile details, actions, and risk assessments.
  • Analysis: Filtering reports using Smart Groups to identify trends.
  • Action: Utilizing Smart Groups for subsequent actions and interventions.

Reporting Use Cases with Smart Groups

There are several ways you can use Smart Groups with reporting:

  • User History: Reviewing phishing and training performance.
  • Profile Attributes: Filtering by location, job title, or department.
  • Creation Date: Comparing recent hires with long-term employees.
  • PhishER Data: Examining interactions with actual threat emails.

To track security objectives, it's helpful to convert those objectives into Smart Groups. For example, you can monitor repeat reporters by creating Smart Groups that monitor users who have reported phishing emails multiple times within specified quarterly periods.

For more information, see our Smart Groups Reporting Automation Guide.

Creating Reports to Answer Specific Questions

Reports can address specific questions about various data points, such as regional phishing performance, failure trends over time, and quarterly progress. You can use Smart Groups to create reports and filter your data more specifically.

Regional Phishing Performance

You can use the Email Templates Sent Reports to compare phishing performance across Smart Groups in various regions.

  1. From your KSAT console, navigate to the Reports tab > Email Templates Sent Reports tile.
  2. Ensure the Emails Sent by Group report is selected.
  3. In the User Groups filter, select the Smart Groups you want to compare.
  4. Select the Date Range you want to compare the different regions over.
  5. Click Apply Changes.

Failure Trends Over Time

You can use the Phishing Activity Reports to provide an overview of users in Smart Groups who failed or reported multiple tests, including their manager information. These reports can be exported for comprehensive data analysis.

  1. From your KSAT console, navigate to the Reports tab > Phishing Activity Reports.
  2. Ensure the All Phishing Activity Grouped by User report is selected.
  3. Adjust the filters and timeframe to include the data you want selected. The data includes user groups, phishing campaigns, user status, and more.
  4. Click Apply Changes.

Quarterly Progress

You can create custom dashboards in executive reports to track and share global and regional quarterly progress.

Executive reports provide a toolset to compare multiple metrics simultaneously, addressing high-level inquiries such as quarterly performance in specific regions. These reports visualize trends like Risk Score fluctuations or reported phishing percentages by region.

Note:Executive reports remove most of the need to pre-create Smart Groups since they can do segment aggregations immediately from user profile fields.
  1. From your KSAT console, navigate to the Reports tab > Executive Reports subtab.
  2. Edit, create, or schedule your report to generate automatically as needed.

articles.name: Legacy Outlook Add-In
articles.title: Legacy Outlook Add-In
articles.body:
This article discusses the legacy COM add-in. We strongly encourage organizations to use the web add-in for a full, feature-rich experience as the COM add-in includes functionality not currently supported within the Microsoft Office JS framework. More information about the web add-in can be found in the Web Add-In Knowledge Base section.

The legacy COM add-in integrates with Microsoft Outlook Desktop for Windows on desktop and laptop systems, enhancing email security and communication management. The add-in monitors outgoing messages to identify potentially misaddressed recipients and facilitates email encryption through the standard Microsoft Outlook interface. Users can read, compose, and respond to secure messages without leaving their email client. The add-in includes access management features allowing for message revocation when necessary, providing control over sensitive information after transmission.

The differences between the COM and Web add-in are displayed in the table below:

Feature Microsoft Outlook Add-in (COM) Microsoft Outlook Add-in (Web)
Available for All users, free or licensed Licensed customers: 50 employees
Supported Outlook Microsoft Outlook for Windows 2016, 2019, Pro Plus, or Office 365 Office 365 for Windows, Outlook Web Access, Outlook for Mac
Protect Gateway Encryption Yes Yes
Protect Local Encryption Yes No

Protect Large File Transfer

 Yes Yes, but not supported for Classic Outlook
Prevent Yes Yes
Prevent DLP Yes Yes
Large File Transfer Yes Yes

If you believe your organization needs to use the legacy COM add-in, download the .exe or .msi file below:
